author: @neotech7272
text:
Biggest Scam of Modern India - Ola Electric
Recently from last 2 months Ola closed all service centre across India. They haven't given salary to Technicians. No Parts replaced under warranty. So they saved around 50 crores in 2 month. Their technicians has stole parts from scooters lying at service centre and stored in their store. Example Ola filed case of Rs3 crores worth parts stolen at Sarkhej police station and demand 3 crores from insurance company. 
Moreover Ministry is backing them due to mysterious reason.

Share as much as possible.

author: @saianuushm.a3945
text:
I bought my Ola S1 Pro Gen 2 in summer 2024. After a few months, I gave it for service because the maps were buggy and I wanted a general cleanup. The experience was terrible. They made me park it outside in the dust, asked me to set a weak 6-digit password, and after the service nothing changed. They didnâ€™t even clean it â€” just said they â€œchecked brakesâ€ and â€œupdated software.â€

Now after the Oct 2025 update, the software is finally okay, but Iâ€™ve decided Iâ€™m never giving my Ola for service again. I still have scratches and a broken rear number-plate LED, and Iâ€™m avoiding service on purpose.

My opinion: If you own an Ola, donâ€™t expect their service to make your scooter better â€” it might actually make it worse.
